Service_name: Community Center (The Salvation Army of Santa Monica)
Description: The Santa Monica Corps Community Center is a resource of Christian ministry for worship and social interaction, which also provides services to address the needs of local residents of all ages.The programs and services offered through theSanta Monica Corps are specific to the needs of the communities in which we are located. We serve people of all ages– from children to seniors, and to a wide variety of needs. Services offered at the Community Center include:- Food & Nutrition Programs- Seasonal Services- Casework Services- Group Work Services- Worship Services - Church and Sunday School- Christian Education- Women's and Men's Ministries- Music & Arts Programs- Residential Camping ActivitiesThe food pantry is open Monday through Friday from 9 AM to 11 AM only.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Service_name: Emergency Assistance (East San Gabriel Valley Coalition for the Homeless (ESGVCH))
Main_Services: ['help pay for housing', 'food pantry', 'meals', 'bus passes', 'personal hygiene', 'counseling', 'navigating the system', 'one-on-one support', 'advocacy & legal aid']
Description: The ESGVCH staff sees to the emergency needs of the homeless and those at risk. This could be a hot slice of pizza, a sack lunch, showers, hygiene kits, bus tokens, motel vouchers for families and counseling and advocacy for those who need help. The clients often use the Emergency Assistance office address to receive their mail.This program provides:- Meals- Transportation vouchers- Hygiene kits- ShowersThe office is located in the St. Martin de Porres Center at the rear of St. John Vianney Catholic Church. Staff also assist clients with information and referrals for medical, dental, domestic violence, drug, alcohol counseling, and housing.Program clients may also access:- Help Navigating the System- Help finding Healthcare- Help Finding Housing
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Service_name: Thursday Food Bank (Central City Neighborhood Partners)
Location_Address: 501 South Bixel Street, Los Angeles, CA 90017
Description: Central City Neighborhood Partners (CCNP) is a non-profit dedicated to create system changes that benefit low-income children, families and communities. Every Thursday we have a food distribution. It begins at 10 a.m. until the supplies are out. One bag per family. For more information, please call us at 213.482.8618.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Eligibility: ['Must make a donation of $40 or donate your time as a volunteer for one part time day of 4 hours.']
Description: World Harvest provides food, basic staples and living essentials to people who are at risk of hunger and the needy. If you find yourself in the situation that you need immediate food assistance, or are threatened by not having sufficient food to supply you or your family's basic needs, WHFB is here to help you.Services provided:- Food to meet basic nutritional needs For working families or individuals whose financial intake isn't sufficient to cope with daily food requirements, you can access a cartful of groceries, an average of 150 pounds of food, with a flat rate donation of $30 after a brief registration process.However, if you are not able to cover this amount, we will provide you with the same benefits in exchange for your time as a volunteer for one part time day, 4 hours. Your donation helps us cover the costs of food transportation, basic maintenance and management service for WHFB, allowing us to function and make available our food items to you.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Service_name: Emergency Assistance Canoga Park (Catholic Charities of Los Angeles, Inc.)
Main_Services: ['emergency payments', 'help pay for housing', 'help pay for utilities', 'emergency food', 'food pantry', 'diapers & formula', 'clothing', 'transportation', 'help find healthcare', 'navigating the system']
Description: Emergency Assistance strengthens families and individuals in distress and helps prevent homelessness. Operating from the agency’s 18 community service centers, the assistance helps thousands of families stay together and maintain intact homes for their children.This program provides:- Financial assistance for rent or utilities bills- Fresh and healthy groceries- Guidance in applying for state-sponsored health care- Diapers- Transportation assistance- Linkages to community resourcesThese essential services stabilize individuals and families when they most need it, thereby preventing domestic fractures that can have long-term negative effects.Assistance may vary by location. Please reach out by phone to determine what assistance is available.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA, Santa Barbara County, CA and Ventura County, CA.

Service_name: FISH of West Valley Community Resource Center (Congregational Church of Chatsworth)
Other_Services: ['emergency food', 'help find missing persons', 'baby supplies', 'clothing', 'home goods', 'medical supplies', 'personal safety', 'toys & gifts', 'personal hygiene', 'help find healthcare', 'counseling', 'animal welfare', 'support network', 'preschool', 'translation & interpretation']
Eligibility: ['This program is accessible to residents of Los Angeles County, CA only.']
Description: A ministry of the Congregational Church of Chatsworth, FISH has been serving the West Valley since 1971. Since its early days as a food pantry, FISH has continued to evolve and expand services to meet the growing needs of its West Valley community.  While, most food pantries only allow recipients to get food once a month, at FISH, our recipients can return each week to receive a healthy assortment of food customized to their family size and needs. FISH also delivers food to seniors and others unable to leave their homes. FISH also provides pet food, diapers, clothing, and hygiene products when available.As a resource center, FISH also helps connect recipients to the services they need, from legal help, safe parking, and a path to permanent housing. FISH also works closely with partner organization, About My Father's Business, who through their street outreach program, provide resources directly to those in the unhoused community.   In addition, FISH also partners with other nonprofit organizations, such as Little Angels Project and VIDA Mobile Clinic to provide additional services to their community.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Location_Address: 1835 South Hope Street, Los Angeles, CA 90015
Eligibility: ['Must live in one of the following zip codes: 90011, 90220, 90222, 90223, 90224, 90006, 90007, 90013, 90014, 90015, 90017, 90021, 90057 OR be a qualifying referred client.', 'Must have a pantry card (awarded after successfully registering).']
Description: Our Pantry Services provide 45 pounds of nutritious groceries to individuals and families through a  pre-bag model of distribution for groceries. This work addresses food insecurity and poor nutrition for impoverished residents living within the LA county area.All program recipients must first register at https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeTH2y4Rg2OtbommYhcJ6eXYyD9TfkISzxtMWrzHDKB4MIV5g/viewform or by calling 213-747-5347. This application and provided information is used for our internal census. Once registered, guests will receive a pantry card that is valid for one calendar year from Jan 1-Dec 31.*We have made procedural changes in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.  Volunteers will pre-bag the groceries and staff will hand off the bags to our guests. Guests will be served outside the Center one at a time, making sure to keep six feet between themselves, other guests, staff and volunteers and must wear masks. Guests who have a car can receive their groceries through our drive-thru pantry program (located in front of SFC on Hope Street). Please make sure the trunk is empty and the windows are rolled up. If you are an LA resident and wish to receive pantry services, please fill out the Pantry Registration Form on our website before coming to St. Francis Center to receive your groceries.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following postal codes: 90006, 90007, 90011, 90013, 90014, 90015, 90017, 90021, 90057, 90220, 90222, 90223 and 90224.

Description: The Salvation Army of Los Angeles is a place where whole families can find something for everyone. We are committed to serving all who come to us. We invite you to read over the many services we provide and if you have any questions about any of the services we offer, please feel free to give us a call.Services offered at the Community Center include:- Family Services- Utility Assistance- Homeless Assistance- Transportation Assistance- Transitional Housing Referrals- Holiday Meals for Those in Need- Sally's Place for Seniors- Weekly Breakfast and Food Bags- Counseling for Families- Counseling for Couples- Family Christmas Programs- Youth Programs- Multicultural - Ministry- After-School Programs & Computer Lab- Youth Summer Camps
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Los Angeles, CA.

Description: The Family Rescue Center serves individuals and families in need in the West Valley by providing food, clothing, medical and vocational training assistance, as well as referrals as needed. Our ultimate goal is to sustain people in desperate circumstances, empowering them to achieve personal and financial independence. Family Rescue Center exists to meet the needs of low-income families, the hungry, and the homeless in the West Valley.We serve individuals and families by providing, at no cost:- Food Distribution-  Secondhand Clothing-  Holiday Food & Toy Distribution-  Backpacks & School Supplies-  Medical and Vocational Training services- Referrals to other Service AgenciesOur ultimate goal is to sustain people in desperate circumstances, empowering them to achieve personal and financial independence. Please contact us for more information on our services.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following counties: Los Angeles County, CA.

Service_name: SOVA Community Food and Resource Program (Jewish Family Service of Los Angeles (JFSLA))
Main_Services: ['food pantry', 'personal care items', 'counseling', 'navigating the system', 'help fill out forms', 'support network', 'one-on-one support', 'help find work', 'advocacy & legal aid']
Location_Address: 8846 West Pico Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90035
Eligibility: ["Clients must reside in the program's service area.", 'This program helps people with income at or below 150% of federal poverty guidelines.']
Description: At both the SOVA food pantries, individuals can pick up groceries once a month based on food preferences and family size. Participants will be able to meet with caring volunteers and staff who will listen and help connect to the resources.This program provides:- Free groceries- Information and referrals- Supportive servicesOn your first visit, please arrive by the time the pantry first opens in the morning in order to register as a new participant and receive the complete program orientation. You may visit the SOVA pantry once in each calendar month and receive groceries for all eligible household members. Grocery orders are sized according to the number of household members. If you are homeless and do not have refrigeration and/or cooking facilities, you may visit twice each month.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: Los Angeles, CA and Van Nuys, CA.

Eligibility: ['Must live in service area: eastern boundary of Inglewood, Jefferson Blvd on the north, Imperial Highway on the south, and the Pacific Ocean.']
Description: The LAX Food Pantry provides food in the form of groceries to low and no income families and individuals in the area. They distribute bags of groceries sufficient to provide meals for 1-2 days to the families that come to the Food Pantry each week.This program provides:- Food to meet basic nutritional needsClients may come to the Pantry once per week. Clients are required to have some identification or information showing they are in the serving area, but there are no income qualifications.
Coverage: This program covers residents of the following cities: El Segundo, CA, Hawthorne, CA, Inglewood, CA and Los Angeles, CA.

Description: My Friends House addresses the needs of low-income individuals and households that lack a reliable access to affordable, nutritious food and may experience hunger on a regular basis.We support residents by providing:- Nutritious foodsIn order to access the food pantry please arrive at 6AM to receive a ticket with your line number.
